name: Haywood Park Hotel

reviews.text: Very clean hotel with all the amenities and small touches to make it a fantastic stay. Fun and unique hotel that was a department store, elevator says "third floor, childrens wear." Great views of city and rolling hills. Solace restaraunt is world class. Don't miss the chocolate shop. Located in the heart of the city with great surrounding entertainment and small shops. A must stay for anyone visiting Asheville.
reviews.title: Didnt want to leave.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night with 3 other couples. The hotel is centrally located in downtown Nashville within walking distance of restaurants and attractions. The rooms were large and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay again. It is advertised as pet friendly, but we didn't see or hear any animals.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The Haywood is a fun place to stay. It is located in the former Bon Marche' department store--later the Ivey department store. The rooms are very large, with a sitting area of plush furniture. The hotel keeps some of the history of its origins with pictures in the lobby and samples of things you could purchase at the store in the 1950s. We stayed on the second floor and when our elevator arrived the voice said, "Second floor, men's wear"!
reviews.title: Little things mean alot!

reviews.text: But it was the little things about the hotel that we really enjoyed:
reviews.title: Last minute Gem
Perfect place for an "in town" stay
reviews.text: -free valet parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm puzzled about the "middle of the pack" TA ranking for this hotel. Despite the good reviews I read on TA, I was hesitant about the hotel because of its relatively low ranking on TA. Were we ever surprised! The hotel was far above our expectations.
reviews.title: Deserves a top TA ranking

reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful as was our room--404--a Master King. We were floored about how large the room was--and the bathroom was fantastic with a huge granite countertop with double sinks. I've read reviews that said the furnishings were dated, but we found them to be extremely nice. Having a sofa as well as a (large!) easy chair in the room was great--especially since the room was spacious even with these large pieces of furniture. The TVs (one in the bathroom) were flat screen and perfect for the spaces they were in. We loved the luxury linens on the bed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Unique Hotel, Fantastic Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were "serenaded" in the afternoon by singers on the street. My husband was bothered by this so went to the large sitting area right outside our door and read. Most hotels don't offer sitting areas this large and nice on each floor--a definite plus.
reviews.title: Perfect Location in Downtown Asheville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also were pleasantly surprised that even though we were right downtown (a real boon for us), our room afforded a view of mountains off in the distance.
reviews.title: Perhaps the best part of the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Haywood Park and would not stay anywhere else. We drove out to the Biltmore Village area and felt that staying downtown rather than the BV area was the right decision for us. Other than that drive, we walked everywhere.
reviews.title: Perfect Start to Our Vacation!

reviews.text: My husband and I arrived for one night in Asheville, NC. This hotel was recommended because of the location and the resonable price. The staff was excellent. They offered champagne when we arrived, a turn down service with chocolates, and a tote bag when we left. Although the room was a really nice size, it all started with the discovery that the TV did not work. We tried to get the front desk, but were unable to get an answer that evening. The night wore on and none of us got a wink of sleep due to our young child's fever and runny nose (certainly not the hotel's fault). The next morning my husband woke up early for his business meeting, and desperately needed a shower after such a difficult evening. The cold water did not work and the hot water scaulded his hand when checking the temperature. Unable to take a shower he dressed and left unshaven and unclean to an important meeting. Really disappointed and very tired, we went downstairs to let the desk know about the hazardous scorching hot water. The staff explained that when they are slow there can be a "valve issue" causing this problem. I just thank God it was not my young child's hand that was severely burned. Clearly negligent about this "valve issue," the hotel never should have made us pay for a night which may have been more comfortable spent in our car. Exhausted and eager to get on the road for home, we paid our bill with a mere 20% off.
reviews.title: good staff, horrible hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunate evening.
reviews.title: In the middle of it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just celebrated our anniversary at the Haywood Park Hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location can't be beat...walking distance to everything in downtown Asheville. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Champagne greetings...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on New Year's Eve and were very pleased with our experience. As I said in the title, we were greeted with valet parking and good champagne - a big plus in my book. The rooms are HUGE. There is plenty of closet and drawer space if you are staying for a while. The beds were heavenly. There is a comfortable sitting area that you can separate from the beds with a nice, room-darkening drapery.
reviews.title: Customer Service was beyond Great!

reviews.text: The bathroom was also very large and there was a separate dressing area. Don't fall for the claim of "lighted makeup mirror," because it is really more of a mirror with a nightlight on in it - it does not light up the mirror at all. The bathroom and sitting room are plenty bright for getting ready. The bathtub is a garden style - no Jacuzzi jets in our room, though.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Haywood for about five days and couldn't have been happier. The room was very large and comfortable, with a separate sitting area. The location was perfect. It's in the very heart of downtown and of course, everything is within walking distance. The free internet service and free parking were a nice extra.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and well maintained. And the floor was very quiet.
reviews.title: A Delightful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Haywood and would return again.
reviews.title: my stay at Haywood INN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems as if the Haywood Park Hotel pulled out all the stops for us. Large room in the front of the hotel, thus, spectacular view. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, the champagne hit the right note. Everything fun that we wanted to do was within walking distance of the hotel, so our car stayed parked. Each afternoon, at siesta time, we enjoyed the seating area of our room while listening to local musicians playing beneath the large window. Clean environment, courteous and efficient staff--a very delightful three days and nights for us. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!!!!

reviews.text: staying at Haywood Inn was such a pleasure.it is right in the heart of all the action.you can walk out the front door and be steps away from shops,restaraunts,bands playing on the streets,mimes right outside the hotel.there was an alley right next to the hotel,where i could walk my dog and not have to worry about my pup doing her business on the sidewalks. the personnel were all very professional and friendly.i would definitely stay there again.rooms very spacy and cozy,clean.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel getaway

description: From its earliest days as a high-end department store, our location has been the center of Asheville’s social and cultural scene. Haywood Park puts you right in the heart of the Asheville experience — fabulous food, art, theater, live music, nightlife — all within footsteps. And when you’re finished with the dining, dancing, shopping and cheering, you’ll be pampered in rooms that are larger and more luxurious than any other in the area. If you want to truly immerse yourself in the hospitality, excitement and surprise that Asheville is famous for, there’s only one place to stay. Haywood Park Hotel. The Heart of Town.•33 luxuriously appointed, oversized suites ranging in size from 475 to 1,200 sq ft •A Historic Hotels of America property •Complimentary wireless Internet •Complimentary valet & self-parking •Bell service •Concierge services •Champagne at check-in •Nightly turndown service with handmade chocolates from The Chocolate Fetish® •Small gift upon departure •I-home® docking stations •43″ HDTVs in each guestroom & 27″ flat panel TVs in each bathroom •Amenity closet in each suite with a wet bar, mini-refrigerator and Keurig® coffee maker •Fitness center •Business center •Banquet and meeting spaces •100% smoke-free
